thread.title: University of East Anglia scientist lands dream job at NASA
thread.title_full: University of East Anglia scientist lands dream job at NASA | Anglia - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: University of East Anglia scientist lands dream job at NASA
text:
It's a question that's puzzled scientists for decades. Is there life beyond Planet Earth? One man from Norwich hopes to find out for himself when he starts his new job at NASA.
Andrew Rushby is a postgraduate scientist at the University of East Anglia. He was offered his dream job on NASA's research team following his acclaimed study on Earth's habitable lifetime, which found that life on earth will go on for another 1.75 billion years.
UAE scientist Andrew Rushby is preparing to take up his dream job at NASA. Credit: ITV News Anglia Andrew will be based at NASA's Ames Research Centre in Silicon Valley, North California. His research will focus on finding out whether any of the 'exoplanets' outside our solar system could be home to alien life.
'I'm incredibly excited and grateful to have been awarded this prestigious fellowship to continue to carry out the work I love. This is a rapidly developing field which promises to provide wonderful and potentially game-changing discoveries regarding other planets in our galaxy over the coming years.'
